qas.question: Who was the first President of Guinea-Bissau?
How many Guinean soldiers did the PAIGC kill?
Where did one of the massacres occur?
When did the PAIGC acknowledge the executions?

context: <a0_0>Luís Cabral<a0_0/>, brother of Amílcar and co-founder of PAIGC, was appointed the first President of Guinea-Bissau. Following independence, the PAIGC killed <a1_0>thousands<a1_0/> of local Guinean soldiers who had fought along with the Portuguese Army against guerrillas. Some escaped to settle in Portugal or other African nations. One of the massacres occurred in the town of <a2_0>Bissorã<a2_0/>. In 1980 the PAIGC acknowledged in its newspaper Nó Pintcha (dated <a3_0>29 November 1980<a3_0/>) that many Gueinean soldiers had been executed and buried in unmarked collective graves in the woods of <a4_0>Cumerá, Portogole, and Mansabá<a4_0/>.
